title: English (1883) Newberry Study Bible
description:
The 1883 Newberry Study Bible, created by Thomas Newberry (1811 â€“ 16 January 1901), is a seminal work in the field of Biblical scholarship. Newberry, an esteemed English Bible scholar and writer, is renowned for his groundbreaking "interlinear Englishman's Bible." This innovative work juxtaposes the authoritative and time-honored Authorised Version of the Bible with the original Hebrew and Koine Greek texts, offering a profound comparative study that was a significant achievement for its time.

Published by Hodder and Stoughton in London, the Newberry Study Bible reflects Newberry's dedication to providing a deeper understanding of the scriptures. His work stands out for its meticulous attention to the nuances of the original languages, illuminating the richness and complexity of the Biblical texts. This interlinear approach allows readers to appreciate the translation process and the interpretive choices made in the Authorised Version, fostering a more nuanced understanding of the Biblical narrative.

Newberry's contribution to Biblical studies is not just academic; it offers a valuable tool for theologians, scholars, and lay readers alike, who seek to delve into the depths of Biblical language and meaning. His work remains a testament to the enduring quest for a comprehensive and accurate interpretation of the sacred scriptures, bridging the gap between ancient texts and modern readers. The Newberry Study Bible is a classic example of scholarly rigor and dedication to the faithful transmission of Biblical knowledge.
